de.systemagmbh.interfaces.config
Interface ISysConfigItem

All Known Implementing Classes:
ASysConfigItem, DummyISysConfigItem
public interface ISysConfigItem

The configuration tree item.

Every implementation of this interface should be able to handle multiple children with the same name in one item.

An item can be one of the following types:

  • TYPE_CONFIGURATION The root of the configuration.
  • TYPE_SECTION A section can hold subsections and parameters
  • TYPE_PARAMETER A parameter consists of a name and a value

If you are looking for getValue(..) method: All deprecated getter methods have been removed. It is recommended to use de.systemagmbh.common.util.CSysConv to convert the Object returned by getValue()

Version:
$Revision: 1.11 $
Author:
Eugen Obermeier

public ISysConfigItem addItem(ISysConfigItem item)
                       throws CSysConfigFormatException

Parameters:
item - child item to add
Returns:
this item modified
Throws:
CSysConfigFormatException

addItem

public ISysConfigItem addItem(String name,
                              Object value)
                       throws CSysConfigFormatException
Creates a new item with createItem(name,value) and adds it to this item. An item may contain more than one child with the same name.

Parameters:
name - the name of the new item
value - the value of the new item
Returns:
this item modified
Throws:
CSysConfigFormatException - if this item cannot contain child items

removeItem

public ISysConfigItem removeItem(String name)
Removes all children with the given 'name'. Does nothing, if no child with this name exists.

Parameters:
name - name of the item to be removed from this item, if present
Returns:
this item modified

removeItem

public ISysConfigItem removeItem(ISysConfigItem item)
Removes the given item from this item. Does nothing, if the given item does not exist in this item.

Parameters:
item - the item to be removed from this item
Returns:
this item modified

Parameters:
namepattern - the substring each item in the iterator must contain

getItems

public Vector getItems()
Returns a vector of all children.

Returns:
An empty vector if this item has no children.

getItems

public Vector getItems(String namepattern)
Returns a vector of children where 'namepattern' is a substring of their names.

Parameters:
namepattern - the substring each item in the iterator must contain
Returns:
An empty vector if no childrens name matches the pattern.

getItem

public ISysConfigItem getItem(String[] fullName)
                       throws CSysItemNotFoundException
Returns the first child with the same name. This is a convenience method if you already have the name and path of an item in a string array (e. g. as returned by getPath()).

Throws:
CSysItemNotFoundException

getItem

public ISysConfigItem getItem(String name)
                       throws CSysItemNotFoundException
Returns the first child with the same name.

A certain implementation may allow a name including path split by a special delimiter ("/"(slash) recommended).

Example:
You can use 
 anItem.getItem("Section1/Subsection2/Item3");
instead of 
 anItem.getItem("Section1").getItem("Subsection2").getItem("Item3");

Parameters:
name - the name of the child item to search for
Throws:
CSysItemNotFoundException - if no child with this name exists.

getItem

public ISysConfigItem getItem(String name,
                              int searchDepth)
                       throws CSysItemNotFoundException
Get the first child item 'name' from this item. Search backwards in tree up to searchDepth levels to find it.

Parameters:
name - the name of the child item to search for
searchDepth - the number of levels in root direction
Throws:
CSysItemNotFoundException - if not found.

getOptionalItem

public ISysConfigItem getOptionalItem(String name)
Returns the first child with the same name or an empty child, if not found. Use this method to get a value from an item that is not mandatory. Example:
   ISysConfigItem anItem;
   Boolean b;
   b = root.getOptionalItem("This/Path/Does/Not/Exist/theBooleanItem")
       .getBooleanValue(new Boolean(true));
In the given example getItem() would throw a CSysItemNotFoundException.

Parameters:
name - the name of the item to find or the name of the item to create, if not found
Returns:
the found item or a new item with the given name

createItem

public ISysConfigItem createItem(String name,
                                 Object value)
Creates a new item with the given name and the given value that has no parent. The type of the new item is determined by the specified value.
  • value != null type = parameter
  • value == null type = section

Parameters:
name - name of the new item
value - value of the new item.

merge

public ISysConfigItem merge(ISysConfigItem config,
                            boolean append)
                     throws CSysConfigFormatException
Merge this configuration with the specified configuration.

Throws:
CSysConfigFormatException

getType

public int getType()
Returns the type
(e. g. TYPE_SECTION) of this item.

Returns:
-1 for unknown type

getName

public String getName()

Returns the name of this item.

Returns:
the name of the item (this can the name of the configuration, the section or the parameter)

getPath

public String[] getPath()
Returns the complete path from the root to this item. The path ends with the name of the parent item.

Returns:
the path to this configItem

getParent

public ISysConfigItem getParent()
Returns the parent item or null if this is the root item.

getValue

public Object getValue()
Returns the value of this item or null if the value is empty. It is recommended to use de.systemagmbh.common.util.CSysConv to convert the Object returned by getValue() into the expected type.

Returns:
the value of this element or null if the value is empty.

getValue

public Object getValue(Object defaultValue)
Returns the value of this item or the default value, if this item is empty.

Parameters:
defaultValue - the value to return, if this item has no value
